level.heading: PENALTIES FOR VIOLATIONS OF THE CODE OF OFFENSES (§ 28-505)

level.text: A resident who is found guilty of a violation of any Class I (serious) offense, as set forth in § 502, shall be subject to the imposition of any of the penalties set forth in §§ 505.2 or 505.3.

A resident who is found guilty of a violation of any Class II (major) offense, as set forth in § 503, shall be subject to the imposition of any of the following penalties and to any penalty set forth in § 505.3 for Class III (minor) offenses:
Forfeiture of institutional good time credits in accordance with the provisions of chapter 6 of this title;
Change in custody status or housing assignment;
Assignment to adjustment segregation, as defined in § 505.5, for a period not to exceed fourteen (14) days;
Loss of pay, reduction in grade, or change of work assignment; provided, that this punishment shall only be imposed when the offense was committed in the performance of a work assignment;
Transfer to Maximum Security status; or
Extra duty assignment to be performed in the resident’s off-duty time from the resident’s regular work assignment.
A resident who is found guilty of a violation of any Class III (minor) offense, as set forth in § 504, shall be subject to the imposition of any of the following penalties:
Assignment to adjustment segregation, as defined in § 505.4, for a period not to exceed seven (7) days;

Adjustment segregation shall be confinement in a control cell without privileges, but with uncensored correspondence, access to religious and legal reading matter, and at least two (2) hours per week of out-of-cell recreation; provided, that recreation may be restricted due to extraordinary safety and security risk.
